title: Let's be clear: negativity is punishable, no matter how nicely you put it.
body:
Title says it all. Am I wrong?

Edit: Regarding speaking about the state of the match or other players in the match, be it their name, chat, choices, or actions.

For example, "I think there isn't anything we can do to win now."

edit 2: I should have made a poll... I guess I'll do that in Gameplay? Is that kosher, so to say?

replies.body: Yes you are wrong. I can say "damn i suck" and I will never get punished, unless I spam it, in which case it is the spam that gets me punished, not the negativity.

Ah, yes, that's true!

But what about speaking of other people?

> [{quoted}](name=Nightsky Pirate,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=wq3iKH2M,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2020-01-04T05:18:20.744+0000)
>
> Ah, yes, that's true!
> 
> But what about speaking of other people?

Lol yeah with other people im pretty sure its always punishable. I was just being difficult with ya, hope you recognized that. I know what you meant ;) just bein a cheeky little buggah.

Almost every word has multiple meanings/definitions. "Negativity" is one of those. Respectfully saying, "No" is essentially a negative response. This is practically what your thread is about and it is kind of stupid. Everyone except you knows which definition of negativity that Riot is talking about. 

"Don't be Negative" is just their politically correct way of saying, "Don't be an asshole".

I am being specific enough when I say "negativity". Of course it is in the same regard that Riot uses it. Clearly I'm not speaking of negative language, a charge of electricity, mathematics, or anything to do with photos.

Of course negativity =/= being an asshole. It's obvious they don't want assholes, but the punishment system isn't built on "don't be an asshole", it's built on "don't be a negative player". I've read that a board member said (as best I remember): "One of the biggest differences between Riot NA and Riot KR is that players freely criticize each other to help each other improve in Korea."

I'm not talking about a forum user, don't be daft.

Peruse the folks banned here though, and you'll see "you were negative and that was the last chance" as the answer to why they were banned.

So is even minimal negativity (as you obviously understand what I am saying) grounds for restrictions or suspension?

Your answer seems to suggest "No", if you translate "don't be negative" with "don't be an asshole".

i think saying "i think there is nothing we can do anymore" isnt toxic.
it might be a (realistic) statement.
lets just go with an unrealistic moment that still happened.
its 7 kills to 53, you got no towers while the enemys got 2 of your inhibs at 24min.
also you had a strong early comp that falls of hard late.

i think its save to say that you cant do anything anymore.
So "No" is your answer- so long as the negativity is assuredly correct? It surely is negative.

idk in my eyes its more negative to make fools hope that there is a chance to win this game when we all know certain games can only be won if at least 3 of the enemys have a heart attack irl and thus are unable to continue playing.
and even then they still dance around your nexus and have automatic autoattacks enabled and might kill you lol.

es its a stupid topic imo. i know most ppl disagree with what i just said but thats just how i see this situation
Crap, I hope riot doesnt discover the time I wrote " I just love the number -43!" My negativity surely will get punished

Ok, here's my actual opinion:  while minor negativity such as the quoted example will do nothing but hurt team morale, it's not punishable unless its frequent. I've played with players who I know are overall positive players(some of which frequent the boards) that display minor negativity from time to time. As long as it's not frequent and as long as you dont escalate the situation, theres not really much harm. 

Now if you spend all game(or even a decent amount of time) typing about how you cant win, then yeah, you're probably going to get punished for that.
In the end, if one were to say the quoted example every time they were losing, and they got reported JUST for that every time, they would get punished, yes?
It's extremely unlikely that you would get punished.

I do insist on being nit-picky, because Murphy's Law. This is a black and white question, there is no grey area. Remember, a bot program is calling the shots on who gets punished.

Given that, it seems the answer is "Yes", with the caveat that it seems unrealistic. Indeed, it is, because most people wouldn't report that, *but they can, and it **is** punishable.*

Even if it gets reported I dont think you'll get banned for it. You generally have to have a cross a negativity Ã— severity threshold and that just doesnt come anywhere close to reaching it.

If you want an actual official answer I'd try tweeting at riot games support or submitting a ticket.

Got an answer from the ticket, and it's as expected:

"I cannot say for sure but I suggest that you prevent any sort of profanity or negativity because it might be grounds for restrictions or suspension."

I'll go ahead and do that. I had thought any negativity could result in a ban, I'll share the result. Ultimately, the ticket support is there to help people understand why they got punished or to help resolve issues, not declare what the rules are. The individual who will answer has no authority to do so.

I believe it is the same for those on Discord. I'll post there too and share.

Yes, you are wrong.

Who gives a fuck if someone is negative. Just mute the fucker. Done. Problem solved.

Actually eliminated problem. Done. Welcome to the fucking internet.


What I can't solve, is that fucker running it down, ruining the game experience for everyone involved, and we're trapped.

I can't solve that winning and losing feel the same lately.


Grow a fucking brain. Negativity isn't a problem, gameplay punishment and matchmaking are a massive problem that can't be solved with a button press.

You are extremely fucking wrong, and no where fucking close to right.

Look further into the issues that plague the game. This thought process that you are attempting to further, is a huge huge huge detriment to the game.

What the fuck has punishing for 'negativity' done for the game?
All its done is give the power to the trolls and the rest of us can't say a fucking word about it.


For fucks sake, PLEASE think more.


However, what you said isn't technically wrong. By the rules, yes, negativity is punishable.

The real question should be, is punishing negativity effective at improving the game? Is it even effective at removing negativity? I think an inanimate object would realize that it clearly is not.

We all need to stop giving a fuck about what a stranger thinks about us. You shouldn't give a fuck about what they say. Riot shouldn't moderate anything, then all this shit would become old and no one would care anymore.

Then maybe everything would return to normal. All this attention to flaming and hate speech and whatever bullshit just encourages people to use it to gain attention.

What do you do when kids try to annoy you? If you show annoyance they keep doing it, if you completely ignore them they get bored and stop.

Things that used to be common sense are now rocket science.

Whether you agree or disagree with banning for toxicity, riot does it because if they didnt it would hurt their business. Imagine the articles criticizing them, imagine the players who quit because of it, imagine the investors who want nothing to do with them.

Thats not how the system works lol .... i have around 2k reports on my main account and i havent got even 10 chat restriction and im using the chat a lot. Its only because im using it to help the team , you using it to insult them... thats the difference..
